title.narrative: INCREASED ACCESS TO INCLUSIVE BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Children, including vulnerable children, from early childhood to adolescence, have increased access to inclusive basic education., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized and those affected by humanitarian crises, are provided with inclusive and equitable qualityeducation and learning opportunities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, including vulnerable children, from early childhood to adolescence, have increased access to inclusive basic education.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, more than 30,000 refugee children, 5,000 children with disabilities, and 4,500 pre-primary aged children had opportunities to access quality education, in a strengthened inclusive school environment and home settings following the Government enforced-school closures to prevent the COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control) [COVIDSitRep]
